evidence.text: In October 2023, Plaintiff Erie County, New York, applied for a grant from Defendant Corporation for National and Community Service (“Americorps”). The purpose of the grant—called an “RSVP” grant, or Retired and Senior Volunteer Program—is to support older people in the Buffalo area, who may struggle to get out of the home, by creating a network of senior volunteers to check in on their wellbeing and drop off homemade meals, a program commonly known as Meals on Wheels. In January 2024, Americorps approved the grant. One year worth of funding was to be distributed immediately, and the term of the grant would run three years so long as Erie County remained in compliance with the grant terms.

extracted.value: Erie County applied for and received a $250,000 RSVP grant in October 2023 (approved January 2024) to support senior volunteer programs including Meals on Wheels for Buffalo-area seniors.

evidence.text: Erie County explained in its application that 'Focused initiatives are underway directing a portion of our recruitment efforts to some of the more culturally diverse areas of our region. This effort should allow us to expand our base of volunteer membership to better reflect the diversity of Erie County.' ... 'To increase our DEIA work, we are actively working to recruit a diverse group to our Advisory Council to include more BIPOC [Black, Indigenous, and People of Color] members.'

extracted.value: Erie County's 2023 grant application explicitly described diversity efforts including recruitment from culturally diverse areas and plans to increase BIPOC representation on the Advisory Council.

evidence.text: On January 20, 2025, the President signed Executive Order 14151, titled 'Ending Radical Government DEI Programs and Preferencing.' The order, in relevant part, required federal agencies to 'terminate, to the maximum extent allowed by law, all . . . 'equity-related' grants or contracts' within sixty days. ... Americorps appears to have done what many other agencies across the government did: Search for the word 'diverse' or 'diversity' in grant applications and threaten those grantees, including Erie County, with termination unless they certify ... that they do not operate programs promoting DEI.

extracted.value: On January 20, 2025, Executive Order 14151 directed federal agencies to terminate 'equity-related' grants within 60 days, leading Americorps to demand Erie County certify it does not promote DEI programs.

evidence.text: Erie County’s RSVP has been operating continuously since 1973. The program currently has over 50 active volunteer stations serving seniors throughout Erie County. Approximately a third of the Erie County Department of Senior Services’ budget comes from the federal government, mostly through grants funded by the Older Americans Act.

extracted.value: Erie County's RSVP program has operated continuously since 1973 with over 50 volunteer stations serving seniors across Erie County, receiving approximately one-third of its budget from federal grants.
